intro: Hermannia teitensis, commonly known as the Taiti Hermannia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect perennial with opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, with prominent stamens that give it a striking appearance. Hermannia teitensis is often found in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories.
